bibl.title: Shifting Cultural Frontiers in Late Antiquity.

bibl.seg: Sofie Remijsen, ""Blushing in Such Company?"" The Social Status of Athletes in Late Antiquity.
David Brakke, Deborah M. Deliyannis & Edward Watts (edd.), Shifting Cultural Frontiers in Late Antiquity (Farnham - Burlington, VT, 2012) pp. 199-209.

The higher-status, 'professional' athletes of the classical world disappeared by the late fourth century, being replaced by two distinct groups: rich amateurs, who competed in the remaining great competitions, and lowly entertainers, who appeared in circus games, as attested at Oxyrhynchus.
